triples.name: Large language model
triples.relevance: LLMs are the core foundation enabling autonomous agent reasoning and planning capabilities.

triples.name: Multi-agent system
triples.relevance: Multi-agent systems are the central architectural pattern being surveyed for LLM-based implementations.

triples.name: Artificial intelligence
triples.relevance: The broader AI field encompasses the development of intelligent autonomous systems discussed in the survey.

triples.name: Autonomous agent
triples.relevance: Autonomous agents are the individual intelligent entities that compose LLM-based multi-agent systems.

triples.name: Reasoning system
triples.relevance: Reasoning systems provide the logical foundations for agent decision-making and problem-solving capabilities.

triples.name: Automated planning and scheduling
triples.relevance: Automated planning is a key capability that LLM-based agents use for action sequence generation.

triples.name: Problem solving
triples.relevance: Problem-solving is explicitly identified as a principal application area of LLM-based multi-agent systems.

triples.name: Computer simulation
triples.relevance: World simulation is explicitly identified as a principal application area of LLM-based multi-agent systems.
